{"step_by_step_thinking": "Chimeric antigen receptor (CAR)-T cell therapies are a type of immunotherapy that have been developed for the treatment of certain types of cancer. They involve modifying a patient's own T cells to express a receptor specific for a particular antigen on the cancer cells, allowing the T cells to recognize and kill the cancer cells. I know that the FDA has approved several CAR-T cell therapies for the treatment of certain B cell malignancies, such as diffuse large B cell lymphoma and acute lymphoblastic leukemia.", "answer_choice": "A"}
